abstract: Wall St. donations take a hard right turn; Bank staffers flee to become farmers; A primer on the foreclosure crisis.
snippet: Wall St. donations take a hard right turn; Bank staffers flee to become farmers; A primer on the foreclosure crisis.
lead_paragraph: –From Slate’s review of The Social Network: Aaron “Sorkin explains that the filmmakers went to great pains to discern what “kind of beer [Facebook‘s founder, Mark Zuckerberg] was drinking on a Tuesday night in October seven years ago.” In reality, the name of the beer —Beck’s — can be uncovered with a simple Google search. Sorkin’s sincerity is harder to locate.”
